name: inarguable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
true, and impossible to doubt or argue over: The evidence in this case is inarguable. It is inarguable that he knows the literature well.
More examplesFewer examplesDoctors agree that brain damage is an inarguable side-effect of a knockout. An inarguable low point has been the corruption scandal.He begins with the seemingly inarguable observation that some of us are cleverer than others.What is inarguable is that supermarket shelves would look very different if the full costs of getting foods to market were reflected in the price.
